ext_descriptions.ext_description: An specifies a requirement to control the orientation of a feature.
the datum system that defines the datum reference frame for this .
A a requirement to control the runout at each cross section of a circular feature.

the direction in which the runout tolerance is controlled. If the angle is specified, the runout tolerance applies in this angle which is fixed with respect to the datum axis. If the angle is not specified, the runout tolerance applies normal to the surface generated by the rotation.
the datum system that defines the datum reference frame for this geometric tolerance.
A Coaxiality_tolerance specifies a requirement to control the concentricity of a feature to a datum feature.
the datum system that defines the datum reference frame for this geometric tolerance.

A Compound_datum specifies a set of two or more Single_datum objects of equal importance which are used to establish a single datum plane or axis. A compound datum is sometimes called a multiple datum feature or a common datum.
the set of Single_datum objects that form the Compound_datum.
A Concentricity_tolerance specifies a requirment to control the concentricity of a feature to a datum feature.
the datum system that defines the datum reference frame for this geometric tolerance.
A Cylindricity_tolerance specifies a requirement to control the form of a cylindrical feature.
A Datum specifies a point, line, axis, or plane used as a reference for locating and orienting tolerance zones.
the precedence of the Datum.
A Datum_target specifies a portion of a feature. A Datum_target is a component of a Datum_target_set.
the identifier of the Datum_target in a Datum_target_set.
A Datum_target_set specifies a set of Datum_target objects,

the type of datum that is formed by the Datum_target_set. The rule_description 'V-block' indicates that two Datum_target objects on a cylindrical element are supposed to form the areas of contact in a V-shaped fixture.The rule_description need not be specified for a particular Datum_target_set. If present, there shall be exactly one object that defines the rule_description for a Datum_target_set.
the set of Datum_target objects that form the Datum_target_set.
A Flatness_tolerance specifies a requirement to control the flatness of a planar feature.

A Geometric_tolerance specifies a requirement to control the allowed deviation of the shape of a product from its theoretically exact shape. Its interpretation is specified by the part of STEP that uses this Application Module.
the Shape_element that the Geometric_tolerance is associated to.
the Tolerance_condition that is associated with the application or the Geometric_tolerance.
the word or group of words by which the Geometric_tolerance is referred to.
additional information about the Geometric_tolerance. 'NOT CONCAVE'

the size of each element, when the tolerance applies separately to certain elements of a feature.A flatness_tolerance may apply to any 2x2 mm area of a surface, but not simultaneously to the entire surface.
the number of decimal digits indicating the accuracy of the tolerance value.

A Geometric_tolerance specifies a requirement to control the allowed deviation of the shape of a product from its theoretically exact shape. Its interpretation is specified by the part of STEP that uses this Application Module.
A Geometric_tolerance_relationship specifies a relationship between two Geometric_tolerance objects.
the first of the two objects related by the Geometric_tolerance_relationship. The semantics of this attribute is defined by the attribute relation_type.
the second of the two objects related by the Geometric_tolerance_relationship.The semantics of this attribute is defined by the attribute relation_type.

the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable, the following values shall be used:
precedence: The relating Geometric_tolerance is of higher priority than the related;
simultaneity: The relating and the related Geometric_tolerance shall be met simultaneously, that is, in the same actual datum reference frame.
Other kinds of relation may be specified if appropriate to a particular tolerancing system. The location of a each feature of a pattern of features may be specified with a geometric tolerance, and the relationships between the features in the pattern may be specified by another. A different position tolerance may be specified for each end of a long hole. A Geometric_tolerance_relationship could be used to express that an interpolated value applies at intermediate points, thus creating a conical tolerance zone

A Line_profile_tolerance specifies the definition of a uniform boundary along the true profile within which the elements of the toleranced surface shall lie. The tolerance zone established by a Line_profile_tolerance is two dimensional.
a plane which defines the elements to which the tolerance is applied.
the datum system that defines the datum reference frame for this geometric tolerance.
A specifies a requirement to control that a surface or a curve shall be parallel to a Reference_datum, with an allowed amount of deviation.
a plane which defines the elements to which the tolerance is applied.
the datum system that defines the datum reference frame for this geometric tolerance.
A Perpendicularity_tolerance specifies a requirement to control the perendicularity of a surface or a curve with respect to a datum plane.
a plane which defines the elements to which the tolerance is applied.
the datum system that defines the datum reference frame for this geometric tolerance.
A Placed_target specifies a Datum_target that is represented implicitly by parameters.
the Cartesian_coordinate_space in which the Axis_placement that serves as parameter_reference is defined.
the Axis_placement that the parameters or the Placed_target refer to.

A specifies a requirement to control the position of a Shape_element that is a feature of size. It can be interpreted either as defining a positional boundary within which the entire feature is permitted to lie, or as defining a tolerance zone within which the centre, axis, or centre plane of the considered Shape_element is permitted to lie.
a plane which defines the elements to which the tolerance is applied.
the datum system that defines the datum reference frame for this geometric tolerance.

A Projection specifies a condition where a Tolerance_zone is projected from an element of a part. The projection is external to the part and made from one of the ends of the element for a specified length.
the Shape_element from which the tolerance zone is projected.
the distance from the projection_end where the Geometric_tolerance shall be measured.
A specifies a plane that is used to further specify the application of Geometric_tolerance objects.
A Roundness_tolerance specifies a requirement to control the form of a circular feature.
A Single_datum specifies a point, line, axis, or plane used as a reference for locating and orienting tolerance zones. A single datum is normally derived from a single datum feature.
the word or group of words by which the Single_datum is referred to.
the Datum_target_set , the Derived_shape_element , or the Shape_element that represents the Single_datum.
a Tolerance_condition that is associated with the application of the Single_datum.
A Straightness_tolerance specifies a requirement to control the straightness of a line.
a plane which defines the elements to which the tolerance is applied.
A specifies the requirement to control the profile of a surface.
the datum system that defines the datum reference frame for this geometric tolerance.
A Symmetry_tolerance specifies a requirement to control the symmetry of a feature about a datum.
a plane which defines the elements to which the tolerance is applied.
the datum system that defines the datum reference frame for this geometric tolerance.
A Target_area specifies an area bounded by a closed Shape_element. The shape of the Target_area is described explicitly by a set of curves with reference to the part coordinate system.

A Target_circular_area specifies a Datum_target that is defined by an implicit circle. The Datum_target is the area inside the circle. The centre of the circle is specified by the placing Axis_placement. The orientation of the Target_circle is the x-y-plane of the Axis_placement.
the diameter of the datum target.

A Target_circular_line specifies a Datum_target that is defined by an implicit circle. The Datum_target is the circle, that is, the linear circular element that is the boundary of the circular area. The centre of the circle is specified by the placing Axis_placement. The orientation of the Target_circle is the x-y-plane of the Axis_placement.
the diameter of the datum target.
A Target_point specifies a Datum_target that is defined by a single implicit point. The position of the Target_point is defined by the placing Axis_placement .

A Target_rectangle specifies a Datum_target that is defined by an implicit rectangle.
The centre of the rectangle is specified by the placing Axis_placement . The orientation of the Target_rectangle is the x-y-plane with half the length of the rectangle in positive and half the length in negative direction along the x-axis and with half the width of the rectangle in positive and half the width in negative direction along the y-axis of the Axis_placement.
the length of the Target_rectangle.
the width of the Target_rectangle

A Target_straight_line specifies a Datum_target that is defined by an implicit straight line.
The first end point of the Target_line is specified by the placing Axis_placement . The second end point is located on the z-axis of the Axis_placement at the specified distance.

A Tolerance_condition specifies the material condition of a feature of size, which is its actual size with respect to its size tolerance.The set of candidate tolerance zones for tolerances with datum_reference depends on the material condition of any referenced datum features of size.The set of candidate tolerance zones of a Position_tolerance depends on the material condition of the toleranced feature of size.
the kind of Tolerance_condition.Maximum material condition (MMC) and least material condition (LMC).
A Tolerance_zone specifies the zone wherein all points of the toleranced element shall fall.
the shape of the Tolerance_zone.cylindrical, parallelepiped,or spherical are examples for form_type.
the set of Geometric_tolerance objects for which the Tolerance_zone defines the zone.
A Tolerance_zone_definition specifies the set of Geometric_tolerance objects for which the Tolerance_zone defines the zone.
the Tolerance_zone that is specified by the Tolerance_zone_definition.
the Tolerance_zone that is specified by the Tolerance_zone_definition.
the Shape_element that represents the second bounding element.

A Total_runout_tolerance specifies a requirement to control the runout over a surface with respect to a datum axis the part is rotated about. The tolerance is applied simultaneously to all positions as the part is rotated 360 degrees.
the direction with respect to the datum axis in which a runout tolerance is controlled.
the datum system that defines the datum reference frame for this geometric tolerance.
